Recipe.title: Perfect Prime Rib
Recipe.Description: Cutler worked in the meat department of a Fred Meyer store when he was a teenager. While there, he was told about an article that explains how to cook a perfect prime rib correctly, and incorrectly. This is a summary of the conclusion.

section.instruction:
Mix Salt and Pepper, then sprinkle mixture on entire surface of roast and pat into place.
(You should have some leftover. Don't try to make it all stick.)
Set Roast, ribs at the bottom, in a pan with a raised baking rack.
Bake until meat thermometer says internal temperature is 125°. (Approximately 3½-4 hours.)
Remove Roast from oven, place a tent made of foil over it and set aside.

Change oven temperature to 550°.
(If your oven doesn't go to 550°, go to the highest that it can.)
Let Roast rest while oven comes up to temperature. (Approximately 20-30 minutes.)
Return Roast to oven for 8 minutes.
Remove and carve as soon as possible. (No need for additional resting.)

Notes.note: If necessary, you can let the Roast rest in step 6 for up to 45 minutes.

"Prime" is actually a quality. So "Prime Rib" is a very high quality of Rib Roast. As such, if you are price conscious, ask for a "Rib Roast" at the store. It really doesn't matter much if it is "Prime", "Choice", "Select" or something else.

Modifications.modification: For a little extra flavor, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of fresh Rosemary on the top of the Roast just before placing it in the oven the first time.
